Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) The activity is part of a routine medical treatment and not a research study.
B) The activity is a commercial service offered to the public.
C) The activity is a research study involving an experimental treatment for glioblastoma.
D) The activity is a voluntary survey without any medical interventions.

Correct answer: C) The activity is a research study involving an experimental treatment for glioblastoma.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the clinical trial described in the consent form?
A) To compare the effectiveness of two different surgical techniques for brain cancer; B) To assess the safety and efficacy of TVI-Brain-1 combined with standard therapy for newly diagnosed MGMT unmethylated Grade 4 Astrocytoma; C) To determine the best dosage of radiation therapy for brain tumors; D) To evaluate the long-term side effects of Temozolomide in treating brain cancer.

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of treatment and follow-up for participants in this study?
A) Treatment for 15 weeks with follow-up visits for 5 years; B) Treatment for 12 weeks with follow-up visits for 3 years; C) Treatment for 15 weeks with follow-up visits for 3 years; D) Treatment for 12 weeks with follow-up visits for 5 years
Correct answer: A) Treatment for 15 weeks with follow-up visits for 5 years

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding potential additional costs to the subject in this research study?
A) The subject will be responsible for all medical costs associated with the study.
B) The subject will receive a stipend to cover any additional costs incurred.
C) The Sponsor may pay for the study drug and specific research-related procedures, but there could be added costs to the subject or their insurance.
D) Participation in the study guarantees full coverage of all medical expenses by the Sponsor.

Correct answer: C) The Sponsor may pay for the study drug and specific research-related procedures, but there could be added costs to the subject or their insurance.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is NOT part of the TVI-BRAIN-1 treatment as described in the consent form?
A) Two vaccinations created from the patient's cancer cells.
B) Leukapheresis to collect the patient's immune T-cells.
C) Infusion of activated T-cells after chemoradiation therapy.
D) A series of cognitive behavioral therapy sessions to manage treatment-related stress.

Correct answer: D

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the research study at any time?
A) You will be required to pay a penalty fee for early withdrawal; B) You will be obligated to continue participating in other unrelated studies; C) You will not face any penalty or loss of benefits you are otherwise entitled to; D) You will be prohibited from receiving any standard medical care in the future.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is considered experimental in the context of this study?
A) Standard chemoradiotherapy with temozolomide and divalproex
B) Surgical removal of a portion of the cancer
C) TVI-Brain-1 treatment, including vaccinations with irradiated cancer cells, leukapheresis, and infusion of activated T-cells
D) MRI scans to monitor the progression of the cancer

Correct answer: C

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the TVI-BRAIN-1 clinical trial?
A) 50; B) 100; C) 150; D) 200

Correct answer: B) 100

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort associated with the TVI-BRAIN-1 treatment as described in the consent form?
A) Temporary hair color change; B) Growth of insufficiently irradiated cancer cells at the vaccination site; C) Increased risk of common cold; D) Improvement in night vision

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes the potential benefits of participating in the TVI-BRAIN-1 clinical trial?
A) Participants will definitely experience an improvement in their glioblastoma condition.
B) Participants will receive financial compensation for the improvement of their health condition.
C) Participants may or may not benefit from the study treatment, but the information gained may help in future glioblastoma treatments.
D) Participants are guaranteed to receive a new FDA-approved treatment for glioblastoma.

Correct answer: C) Participants may or may not benefit from the study treatment, but the information gained may help in future glioblastoma treatments.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative treatment options available to you if you decide not to participate in the TVI-BRAIN-1 clinical trial?
A) Surgery to remove a portion of your cancer followed by a different experimental immunotherapy; B) Surgery to remove a portion of your cancer plus chemoradiotherapy with temozolomide and divalproex; C) Surgery to remove a portion of your cancer followed by supportive care such as hospice; D) There are no alternative treatments available outside of the clinical trial.

Correct answer: B) Surgery to remove a portion of your cancer plus chemoradiotherapy with temozolomide and divalproex.

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a direct result of participating in this study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation for the costs of treatment?
A) The study sponsor will reimburse all reasonable and necessary costs of treatment, including hospitalization.
B) You will receive a fixed payment for any injury regardless of the actual costs incurred.
C) The study will cover lost wages and other forms of compensation for research-related injuries.
D) You will be responsible for all costs associated with the treatment of the injury.

Correct answer: A) The study sponsor will reimburse all reasonable and necessary costs of treatment, including hospitalization.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience a serious side effect during the study, whom should you contact immediately?
A) The study sponsor; B) Your personal physician; C) Dr. Michael Salacz at the provided 24-hour contact number; D) The National Institutes of Health

Correct answer: C) Dr. Michael Salacz at the provided 24-hour contact number

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to discontinue participation in the study?

A) You may discontinue at any time, but it may result in a penalty.
B) You may discontinue at any time without penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to.
C) If you discontinue, you will lose access to certain medical treatments.
D) Discontinuation is only allowed with prior approval from the study coordinator.

Correct answer: B) You may discontinue at any time without penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to.
